org_name: JPS Health Network (John Peter Smith Hospital)

request_pathways.name: Authorization & Request for Release of Information (English)
Authorization & Request for Release of Information (Spanish)
Fax submission to Health Information Management
Mail to Health Information Management, 1500 S. Main Street, Fort Worth, TX 76104

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a generic ROI authorization form (image-only scan from 2018), print and handwrite it, then mail or fax it to Health Information Management.

red_flags: $75 flat fee for electronic delivery likely exceeds HIPAA's reasonable, cost-based fee limit for patient access requests
$30 minimum for first 10 pages may exceed permissible patient access fees under federal rules
Fee schedule does not distinguish patient access requests from third-party releases
Electronic form submission explicitly refused despite organization demonstrating capability with 2025 HIE forms
ROI form is a 2018 image-only scan with no text layer or fillable fields — inaccessible to screen readers
bright_spots: Spanish language version of ROI form available
Fee schedule disclosed transparently on web page before form download
Patient Records page is well-organized and easy to find (2 clicks from homepage)
2025 HIE forms demonstrate organizational capability for modern, fillable, email-submittable PDFs

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation (Patient Tools → Patient Records, 2 clicks) and via web search; page is well-organized with accordion sections and contextual information.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — the ROI form is an image-only scan with zero fillable fields, requiring printing and handwriting; fax submission is available but the form itself cannot be completed digitally.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: The form is an appropriate 1-page length, but being an image-only scan prevents assessment of language clarity; the surrounding web page provides adequate context but no instructions appear on the form itself.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not specifically addressed — the generic ROI form does not differentiate patient access from third-party release, fees are not distinguished by request type, and no patient rights are referenced.

compliance.rationale: Level 2: The $75 electronic delivery fee and $30 minimum for first 10 pages likely exceed HIPAA's cost-based limits for patient access requests; HHS has taken enforcement actions against similar fee structures.

overall.summary: JPS Health Network's ROI process is easy to find but hampered by a seven-year-old image-only scan form, potentially excessive fees, no electronic submission, and no differentiation of patient self-access from third-party release — despite demonstrating the capability for modern digital forms in its 2025 HIE documents.
